channel.title: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?
channel.description: hey everyone i was i was just wondering if anyone knows how to create a cilent for your server i been searching tutorials but did not find anything like it would anyone mind helping me please and thx. :) ;) :D ;D

item.title: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?
item.dc:creator: @KillinXxSMile KillinXxSMile
item.description:
@KillinXxSMile wrote:

Mybb:

it’s not “Coding” it’s “Programming” you fucking twats

it actually can be classified as coding…
i find coding to be more like editing and programming to be like making

like Mr Tom Fordham
“As a programming teacher, one thing does irritate me: the persistent misuse of the word “programming” when the author means coding. Programming is creating the logic, coding is translating that logic into code. Many students come into class able to code, but almost none come in able to program – that is, create the logic. They think sitting down and making spaghetti code is programming.” - Tom Fordham

Read full topic

@jc22493 wrote:

Guth:

java = coding

Java is a programming language, but ‘coding Java’ has become a colloquial term.

item.source: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?

item.title: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?
item.dc:creator: @Guth Guth
item.description:
@Guth wrote:

[quote=“KillinXxSMile, post:5, topic:269288”][quote author=Guth link=topic=355375.msg2720349#msg2720349 date=1237934665]
yeah, download a client base (or any open source client), change the picture on it by looking in the folder, if it’s not there then look in the sprites folder. Then open up client.java and change the name of the client to the name you want your client to be. After that, open un frame_sub_1 and do the same thing. After that, compile and play! And btw if you don’t want to be called a leecher give credits to whoever made the client
[/quote]
adding on to that you can also just go along and actually learn java and code the client so you can actually have some dignity calling the client your own.[/quote]

Yeah but I don’t think that if you don’t know how to even start a client off a open source then you probably can’t code your own client… Not 100%

Read full topic
item.source: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?

item.title: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?
item.dc:creator: @Menno582 Menno582
item.description:
@Menno582 wrote:

Yeah, just download a open client, now edit
it to how you like it, like adding models, GFX’es,
pictures, changing names etc. (if you dont know
how search a tutorial, or just explore). Then you
got a client, or use a IP changer.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?

item.title: How do i create a cilent for my server help me?
item.dc:creator: @KillinXxSMile KillinXxSMile
item.description:
@KillinXxSMile wrote:

Guth:

yeah, download a client base (or any open source client), change the picture on it by looking in the folder, if it’s not there then look in the sprites folder. Then open up client.java and change the name of the client to the name you want your client to be. After that, open un frame_sub_1 and do the same thing. After that, compile and play! And btw if you don’t want to be called a leecher give credits to whoever made the client

adding on to that you can also just go along and actually learn java and code the client so you can actually have some dignity calling the client your own.

Read full topic

Then open up client.java and change the name of the client to the name you want your client to be. After that, open un frame_sub_1 and do the same thing. After that, compile and play! And btw if you don’t want to be called a leecher give credits to whoever made the client
